div.l: They waleweden to gedere as pyggis in a poke
Vp they goon and down a yeen anoon
Tille that thee Mellere spurnede atte a stoon
And down hee fell bacwardis on his wyif
Whiche that wiste no thyng of this nyse stryif
For schee was fallen on slepe a lytell wyght
Wᵗith Iohn thee clerk that waked hadde all nyght
And wᵗith thee falle owt offe here sleep schee breyde
Help holy crois of bromholme schee seyde
¶ In manus tuas lord to thee I calle
Awake simvnd schee seyde the feend is on mee fall
Myin hertte is broke help I ne am but deed
Theer lyght on my wombe and eke on myin heed
Help symkyn for thee fals clerkys fyghtte
This Iohn stertte vp as faste as hee myghtte
And graspede by thee wallis two and froo
To fyinde a staf and schee sterte vp also
And knewe thee estris better thanne dede this Iohn
And by the wall a staf schee foond annoon
Schee sawgh a lytell schemeryngge of a lyght
Fore atte an hoole thee Mone schoon in full byght
And bee that lyght schee sawe hem bothee twoo
But sikirly schee ne wiste whoo was whoo
But as schee sawe a whit thyng in here Eeye
And whanne she gan thee whit thyng asspye
Schee wendde thee clerk hadde wered a volipeer
And wᵗith thee staf schee drowe evere neer ⁊and neer
And wende to have hit aleyn atte the fulle
And schee smoot thee Mellere on the pyled skulle
That down hee gooht and cride owt harroo I deye
Thise klerkys bete hym weell and lete hym lye
And greythede hem and token here hors a noon
And also here Mele and on here wey they goon
And atte thee Melle yit they token here cake
Of half a buchsschell flowr weell I bake
¶ Thus is thee prowde Mellere weell I beete
And hath lost thee gryndyngge of his whete
And yit payde for thee soper everidell
Of aleyn and of Iohn that betten hym weell
His wyif is swivid and his dowghtter als
Loo what hit is a Mellere forto been fals
And theer fore this ꝓproverbe is seyd full sooht
Daar hym nevere weell wene that evell dooht
A gylour schall hym self bee giled bee
And god that syttiht heyghe in Magestee
aue all this cvmpane greete and smale
And thus have I quit thee Mellere his tale
¶ Here Eendyht thee Revis tale
¶ And here be gynniht the kookis tale
Thee kooc of london̄ while the Reve spac
For ioye hym thowghtte hee clawed his bac
Haa ha quod hee for cristis passiovn
This mellere hath a scharp conclusioun
Vppon this argument of herbergage
Weell seyde salamon in his langage
Ne bryngge nowt every man in to thyin hows
For herberwynge bee nyghtte is full ꝑperelows
Weell awghtte a man well avised to bee
Whom that hee herberwede into his previtee
I preye to god so yeve me sorwe and care
Yif evere syhtthe I heyghtte hogge of ware
Herde I evere Mellere better sette on werke
Hee hadde a iape of maleyis in the derke
And ther fore yif yee fowche sawf to here
¶ But god for bede that wee stentte here
A tale of mee that am a poore man
I wille yow telle as weell as I can
A lytel iape that fell in owre Citee
¶ Owre Oost ansswerde ⁊and seyde I gᵃrante it to thee
Now tell on roger loke that it bee good
For manye a pasty haste thow letyn blood
And manye iacke of douere hast thow soolde
That hath been twies hote ⁊and twies koolde
Of many a pilgyim hast thow cristis curs
For offe thy ꝑpersely yit they fare thee wers
That they have etyn wᵗith thee stowbel goos
For in thy schoppe gooht manye a flye loos
